#summary Components for handling HTTP session.

= Introduction =
This section contains information about components for handling HTTP session.


= HTTP Session =
Sometime, applications need maintaining server-side state. When this scenario arises, typically, a server side session is created.

For this purpose, the [http://code.google.com/p/oxeniphonecommons/source/browse/trunk/main/Classes/Session/API/OxICHttpSessionManager.m OxICHttpSessionManager] protocol provides a pluggable HTTP session handler mechanism.


= Implementations =
== Servlet session ==
The [http://code.google.com/p/oxeniphonecommons/source/browse/trunk/main/Classes/Session/Servlet/OxICServletSessionManager.m.m OxICServletSessionManager]  provides an standard [http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Servlet Java Servlet] HTTP session implementation. It reads ans sets the JSESSIONID cookie.

However, since this class stores the session id into a property, it should be a singleton. Inside  a container, it could be declared like this:

{{{
[self.container addDefinition: [OxICObjectDefinition withName: @"httpSessionManager"
                                                     andClass: @"OxICServletSessionManager"
                                                 andSingleton: YES
                                                      andLazy: NO
                                                andReferences: nil
                                                    andValues: nil]
  ];
}}}
